Software

Phovea Web Framework

The current focus of development is the Phovea web application framework.

Phovea is made up of multiple plugins. You can find the Phovea plugin repositories at

https://github.com/phovea/

To get started with Phovea, please refer to the Phovea Documentation

Caleydo Tools

Our team has built many apps based on Phovea. Demo versions of these prototypes are hosted at

https://caleydoapp.org

Some other tools are also accessible via the Tools page or via the Publications page.



Discontinued: Caleydo Desktop Applications

Earlier work by the team produced a number of desktop applications. These are still available for download, but are not actively maintained.

Caleydo Desktop runs on Windows, Mac OS, and Linux and is tested on Windows 7, Ubuntu/Kubuntu of the latest versions and Mac OS X.

Caleydo Desktop requires Java 7. Further installation details can be found when following the links below.

Last Caleydo Desktop Release

  • Caleydo 3.1.5 (including StratomeX, enRoute, Entourage, LineUp)
  • LineUp 3.1.1 (standalone version)
  • Furby 3.1.3beta1 (standalone version)
  • Domino 3.1.5 (standalone version)

Older Releases

  • Caleydo 3.1.0 (including StratomeX, enRoute, Entourage, LineUp)
  • Caleydo 3.1.1 (including StratomeX, enRoute, Entourage, LineUp)
  • Caleydo 3.1.2 (including StratomeX, enRoute, Entourage, LineUp)
  • Domino 3.1.3beta1 (standalone version)
  • Caleydo 3.1.3 (including StratomeX, enRoute, Entourage, LineUp)
  • Caleydo 3.1.4 (including StratomeX, enRoute, Entourage, LineUp)

They come without any warranty; without even the implied warranty of merchantability or fitness for a particular purpose.

The Caleydo source code is available on GitHub: https://github.com/Caleydo/

Caleydo uses a variety of libraries and resources which we gratefully acknowledge here.
